pr_title: fix: Make sure internal client is configured for TLS

timeline.bodyText: is there any reason we ignore the non-string properties? (should we be calling toString on them?)
timeline.author: agavra

replies.bodyText: we're really only interested in the ssl config values which are all strings I think.
replies.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: I'm worried that assumption is a little brittle, at a minimum can we add a comment explaining that?
replies.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: What's the purpose of having both a TLS and a non-TLS listener? Can we just have the TLS listener?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: I think in many cases users will have both listeners, so this validates that the right listener is used in this case.
replies.author: purplefox

timeline.bodyText: Not directly related to this PR, but is it common practice to ignore exceptions on close? I would've expected to at least log the exception?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: It's a pretty common approach if you want a clean close.
replies.author: purplefox
